org.unibl.etf.calculator

Class CalculatorAdvanced

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unibl.etf.calculator.Calculator
      • org.unibl.etf.calculator.CalculatorAdvanced

  • public class CalculatorAdvanced
extends Calculator
    Inherits the Calculator class. Ads support for advanced computation like factoriel calculation, n-th power, check if the currentValue is an Armstrong number, or a perfect number.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Dragan Zrilic

    • Method Detail

      • calculateAdvanced

        public void calculateAdvanced(char action)
                       throws NumberNotInAreaException,
                              NotSupportedOperationException
        Calculates either the power of currentValue or the factoriel depending on the provided action.
        Parameters:
        action - Character which specifies the action which will be applied. For values [0,9] the character is treated as the power, while for value '!' the factoriel of currentValue is calculated
        Throws:
        NumberNotInAreaException - Is thrown if currentValue is out of range [LOWER_BOUND_CA,UPPER_BOUND_CA]
        NotSupportedOperationException

      • hasCharacteristic

        public java.lang.Boolean hasCharacteristic(char value)
                                    throws NotSupportedOperationException,
                                           NumberNotInAreaException
        Checks if currentValue is an Armstrong number or a perfect number
        Parameters:
        value - Specifies which property of currentValue will be checked. Valid inputs are ['A','P']
        Returns:
        Boolean Whether the currentValue has the specified characteristic
        Throws:
        NotSupportedOperationException - Is thrown if value is not a valid input
        NumberNotInAreaException - Is thrown if currentValue is < 1

      • getLowerBoundHc

        public static double getLowerBoundHc()
        Returns:
        double Getter for the lower bound of currentValue in hasCharacteristic method
